newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won ends lower, trapped in tight range.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won ends lower, trapped in tight range.

text.p: The won closed slightly weaker against the dollar on Tuesday after trading in a narrow range, traders said.
The won closed at 844.60, after opening at an intraday high of 844.30. It hit the bottom of 844.80.
Traders said a consolidation of dollar against the yen in the international market and worries of a possible central bank dollar selling intervention halted the won from falling too far.
Some banks holding long dollar positions have also lost appetite for the U.S. unit and started unloading, they said.
"But huge import deals scheduled for early next week will pressure the won for the rest of this week," said one trader.
The base mid-rate is seen at 844.60 for Wednesday, compared with 844.70 on Tuesday.
